alert.note: Alert for Harper; Woods; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Woods, east central Harper and northeastern Woodward Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 700 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles south of Buttermilk to 3 miles west of Freedom to 9 miles west of Waynoka. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waynoka, Freedom, Alabaster Caverns State Park, Avard, and Camp Houston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
